description._content: Thomas Hardy's (1840-1928) career spanned over 50 years. A famous English writer and poet, he set his novels against the bleak imaginary landscape of Wessex, modelled on the Dorset countryside of his birth. After the success of Far From the Madding Crowd in 1874, he devoted himself producing a series of novels, among them Tess Of The D'Urbervilles (1891) and Jude the Obscure (1896). This photograph appears in 'The Cabinet Portrait Gallery' series of celebrity portraits and biographies published in the 1890s. The series includes royalty, actors, academics and authors. We're happy for you to share this digital image within the spirit of The Commons. Certain restrictions on high quality reproductions of the original physical version of apply though; if you're unsure please visit the National Media Museum website. For obtaining reproductions of selected images please go to the Science and Society Picture Library.
